file_content.text: So this is where the war is focused, huh? Maybe someday it'll look like Taris.
Corellia represents the Empire's greatest prize. It would be an honor to gift wrap it.
War ravages this place--the people will never be the same. It saddens me deeply.
I can feel the war here--it makes the marrow in my bones swell. So exhilarating.
Finally, Corellia--soon to be the site of the Empire's greatest victory.
The Sith clan ravages this place. We want in.
A monument to the foolishness of humanity.
Towering buildings, neon signs and big guns. I didn't think I'd ever see this place again after the last time they kicked me out.
I'd only ever seen Corellia in images. It's even more impressive in person.
A city in shambles--an archaeologist's dream, you know. So many layers of history peaking through the cracks, waiting to be uncovered.
I distrust cities. Too many tall buildings. Sniper's nests. Ambushes.
Knew a Corellian pirate, once. Promised to show me his planet sometime. Don't think anyone here expected this.
We never thought we'd visit the Republic Core Worlds. We certainly never thought we'd fight here.
A fine planet for drink, and a fine planet for starships... but not one where I'd like to fight a ground war. Whatever the official word, this will not be a swift battle.
I never thought I'd see the day we invaded the Core Worlds. We should be proud of our troops.
Encrypted communications traffic is heavy. Republic, Imperial and unassigned channels are active.
Can't believe we're standing on one of the founding planets of the Republic. I mean, there was Alderaan, but aside from Coruscant, Corellia is the heart and soul of the Republic.
Used to call this place "home." Don't see that happening again. Just won't be the same once the Imps finish draping their flags over everything.
Urban war zone. No clear front line, easy to get surrounded or ambushed. Messy.
Buildings so tall, and everywhere. Blizz think it must be crowded.
Gonna be another Coruscant. Got a feelin'. Let's get out there 'fore all the good killing's done.
I ever mention I have a fear of dying in a bombing run?
The enemy was forced to retreat from here. But not far.
This has been the site of many deaths. From both sides. The pain of it still speaks to me.
The scent of death is divine here. I will add my own smell.
Heh, Empire blew this area to bits. Wish I could have been in on it.
Hurry, battles rage without us!
So this is the great Corellia. Ha.
This is quite the war, ain't it? I remember these used to be fully functioning factories, pumping out smoke so thick you could choke.
So much devastation. It's not just the buildings. Think of the people who used to work in those factories, the people who used to buy the things they made. This whole war is a waste.
Hmm. Factory structure indicates that these were built about a century ago, though the underlying strata suggests industrialization of the area began much earlier.
Old industrial center. A good place to strike from. Lots of cover, unstable buildings to throw your enemies off guard.
They're not gonna fix this. Even if the Corellians get their planet back, you can't fix this much damage.
It's unfortunate it came to this. It will take a long time to gain the locals' trust.
Impressive use of explosives--it takes exceptional power to level buildings, and really, the wreckage is quite minimal.
We're fighting to take this planet block-by-block. We have to win this.
Scanning explosive residue. Detecting radioactive particles.
This place got hit pretty hard. You think there's still fighting in the area? I'm going to keep an ear out for any scheduled artillery... just in case.
Not exactly how I remember the place. Most of the buildings in Coronet City weren't falling over when I was living here.
Buildings took a hammering. One of these collapses, won't be pretty. Best keep moving.
Empire people making big mess.
Nice mess. Gotta be some cannons 'round here. Oughta nab one.
Nothing like a big war to make you feel small. This is the smallest I've felt since--well--the last planet.
Axial Park will be a challenge to traverse. Many ambush-friendly sites and hard to find cover.
A moment of beauty amidst the ravages of war. Gives you hope, doesn't it?
A beautiful place. We will walk our Corellian slaves here as pets when we finish.
This is where we should have the parade after we take this planet.
We belong on the battlefield!
Someday, even these fields will be consumed in fire.
I crashed in this park once. They filled the crater with water and made a lake. Even in this shape, I'd take Corellia over Coruscant.
Axial Park has a galactic reputation. This was once such a beautiful place. The center of Corellian culture. Now it's as ruined as everything else.
To think, someday some intrepid explorer will excavate the ruins of this park and find traces of us. It really puts things into perspective, doesn't it?
Appearances are deceiving. Relaxing. But trees can hide enemies. Mustn't let your guard down.
Perfect little battlefield downtown. March across the lawn, shoot from the buildings.
They used to film entertainment dramas here. Axial Park was a backdrop to show the Republic at its finest. No longer.
Axial Park. The site of so many clandestine meetings between spies and politicians... we'll be sorry to see that tradition end.
Kaas City has an arboretum in the lower levels. I'm sure this was beautiful, but it hardly compares.
Foot traffic is directed into the cross fire at these points. The park is an elegant murder machine.
This is Axial Park... they're turning it into a killing field. I guess there's nothing the Empire and Republic aren't willing to fight over.
Of all the places to fight over, why choose a park? If you ask me, the Empire and Republic are slugging it out just for the sake of it.
Found my war. Come on, let's show 'em what a Mando's made for.
People forget to build hard ground on this spot?
I'm likin' the view. Gonna stand here and let them have all the fun? Let's get in the fightin'!
Take a picture. I'm guessing this place will never be this pretty again.
Green Jedi Enclave, my lord. We are likely to face opposition here. And they will defend this place to the end.
Master, I sense the calmness of Jedi here. It's always a burden when we face Jedi--more often than not, violence cannot be avoided.
The Green Jedi hide here, trembling, waiting for us to pry them out of their shells.
Heard some of the military brass saying this is where the Jedi are encamped. Always gets me pumped going up against Jedi.
My claws scream for Jedi blood.
I smell Force users.
Place almost makes me want to sit down for a bit, relax. I can almost see what the Jedi like about it. Almost.
There has to be some middle ground. You can't force order on nature like this, but is the only other option to destroy it?
It really is rather gorgeous, isn't it? I'm usually not one for parks, but I have to admire what the Green Jedi have done here.
Trees are good cover. Open spaces, dangerous. Watch for Jedi. Feel their movements. Move faster.
Soldiers, Jedi, CorSec officers... I think we've got an army to fight.
Into the gardens. We swarm upon the enemy, and sing the Song of Fury.
The gardens may be well tended, but there are flaws to be exploited in their defenses. Shall we?
The Jedi take good care of their gardens. Shall we see how they fight?
Jedi combat techniques rely on breath control. I can analyze breathing patterns at a significant distance.
A lot of care went into these gardens. I bet this used to be a great place to relax.
So this is what a Jedi Enclave looks like, huh? Real pastoral. Wonder if they do all their gardening with their lightsabers.
Lot of window dressing, not a lot of fortification. Never expected they'd get attacked here.
Ooh, Blizz like green place. Take break?
Well, ain't this just precious. Thought these wimps were Jedi, look more like a buncha gardeners.
Corellia = key to Republic victory + saving the galaxy // Jedi + T7 = will not fail!
If the Republic can't save Corellia, the Empire wins. It's as simple as that.
I love Corellia. The people, the night life, the fine beverages.... Let's keep this planet in one piece.
This is it. The battle for Corellia will change everything. For the Republic!
Ah, yes. So-called civilization. Look upon Corellia's metal and stone towers. See the insects scurry inside them. Is it any wonder the Emperor seeks to destroy it all?
Empire has struck Republic's heart.
Ah, Corellia. Once home to so many bored heiresses. Where are they now, I wonder.
Corellians never think ahead. This is what happens.
I always meant to take shore leave on Corellia one day. Just kept putting it off.
Father said we'd visit Corellia together one day. I'm almost glad he didn't see it like this.
Whatever else happens here, I'm looking forward to kicking the Empire off Corellia. It's payback time, Captain.
On Corellia, Bowdaar is not a gladiator. On Corellia, Bowdaar fights for freedom.
You can already hear the fighting in the streets. This may be the first time in my life I'm not happy to see a city.
A world at a war. It's like coming home. Let's begin this hunt.
The Force better be with me. I'm too young and handsome to die on Corellia.
Imps marching on Corellia, Rakton inside the Bastion... we've got a lot of work to do.
I've seen what the Empire can do in a place like this firsthand. We should move quickly.
We will not allow Corellia to fall to the Empire. We will defend our citizens at all costs!
Looks like the Imps have a big head start. We'd better move fast, or there won't be much left to fight for.
War scribes its bloody tale across this once-peaceful place.
Major power station = destroyed by bombardment // Civilian losses = high
If we don't hurry, this is what all of Corellia will look like.
If anybody was alive here when the bombing started, they didn't stay that way for long.
The sector suffered heavy bombardment. This must be a major control point.
You see the destruction? Every death here feeds the dark side.
Cowards to use bombs. No points for such killing.
So the Empire isn't interested in taking prisoners.
Hmm. Empire got a clean hit.
Probably a high-altitude strike. Poor souls never stood a chance.
How can the Empire do this? How can they just murder people in their homes?
Whew. Hope we don't meet what did all this damage.
Standing in a crater is bad luck.
This may be the safest place to stand on Corellia. There's nothing left here to fight over.
Nothing left but rubble. The battle here has moved on. Let's find where it went.
I bet a Jedi leveled this building. We're very powerful, you know.
This place has taken some major ordnance hits. The Imps will pay for this.
Extensive bombardment. The Imperials are holding nothing back.
All who serve the Empire will face justice for what has been done here!
The Imps are just smashing everything they can get to, huh? They're going to regret being so careless.
How can our enemies look upon such devastation with pride?
Republic forward lines = strong // Imperial resistance = heavy // T7 + Jedi = standing tall!
Blast the Empire. Forcing us to fight it out in the city's one beautiful place. Typical.
We've gotta keep this park from burning down. Corellia's people need something good to come back to when this is over.
The fighting's getting heavier in Axial Park. The Empire isn't holding back. We can't, either.
The Republic should not bother creating bases like this. Axial Park presents nothing but a tempting target.
Living grass among dead buildings. Is good to see.
If only we had time for a stroll. Axial Park has a rare charm all its own.
Imperials burned down Balmorra's parks. Corellians should appreciate Axial Park while they have it.
It's not often we get an actual walk in the park.
I've only seen Axial Park in holos. The smell's... not how I imagined.
If the Republic doesn't settle this quick, Corellia's gonna wind up looking like Ord Mantell.
The fighting is worse in this park. Bowdaar is ready.
This used to be a nice park. I spent a summer living in those trees, just for fun.
The Republic has changed the rules of engagement. They're using nature against the Empire. Interesting tactic.
You know, I fight a lot better when I've had a good swim. You suppose there's a pond anywhere in this park?
I'm surprised the park hasn't burned to the ground yet. Probably just a matter of time.
Parts of the park are still standing. At least something has survived the Empire's onslaught.
Into the trees, through the buildings, across the roads! We will find our enemies wherever they hide!
Hard to believe there are still trees around when half of the buildings are leveled. Maybe the Imps won't destroy everything after all.
This one place reflects the entire conflict: life and death, perilously close.
Jedi + T7 = liberate Corellia's government + restore freedom!
This is the seat of Corellia's power. Let's kick the Empire out of here for good.
This is where all of Corellia's politicians are--even the good ones who got locked up.
If we can take the central government sector, we'll own Corellia.
The Empire's forces are concentrated here. Break them, and Corellia is yours.
Is where Corellia's elders debated.
The Legislature. Another lovely building wasted on politicians.
Legislature. Housed Imperial collaborators. Let's burn it down.
So that's where Corellia's politicians gambled with people's lives, and lost.
The Republic's buildings are so huge. Even our royal palace isn't half this size.
Look at that fanciness. Why is it the biggest scum always get to live in the nicest places?
Imperials everywhere. Bowdaar could fight here all day.
This is the government district. If we see any expensive and easily transportable objects, I'm sure nobody will miss them. Just a thought....
Welcome to the home of Corellia's true failure: its spineless politicians.
Finally, a place on Corellia that isn't on fire. Why did I say that? I just jinxed it, didn't I?
That's the Legislature. The Imps might think that holding it puts them in charge, but that's not going to happen.
I believe that's the Legislature. Government building and seat of Corellian politics. Captured by the Empire in their first assault.
The Legislature! Seat of democracy on Corellia, but home to the criminals who betrayed us all.
That must be the Legislature building. I'll bet nobody expected the Imps to take that one so easily.
Yuun believes this is the legislature. Former seat of the Corellian government.
Approval: I do enjoy a large metropolis, master. So many chances to liquidate undesirables.
Assessment: Nothing left but to complete the liquidation process. You're too kind, master.
Complaint: These park lands waste space that could house troublemakers for liquidation.
Declaration: I don't care what color these Jedi are--I will liquidate them all!
Assurance: Corellia will not fall, master. I'll delete every Imperial troublemaker personally, if necessary.
Extrapolation: It appears the Empire has made significant progress deleting Corellia's citizenry.
Encouragement: This small wilderness presents many ambush spots. We should take advantage.
Summation: An impressive edifice for a corrupt government. I would expect nothing less.
